Hotel G Singapore
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1815 reviews

The bar is nice but their staffs are not friendly, I asked 3 times for tidying up the table before we take it.

When I waved my hand for order, the staffs just walked pass and no one serves us until the chef came over to take orders. It's a pity that the poor service level in such a nice and new bar. Other than that, the hotel staffs are nice and helpful, the room is tiny but nicely decorated. Highly recommended for solo traveler, actually I stayed at Big Hotel (the previous name of Hotel G) for a few times already, the room rate and the location is worth for money.

Show more
Sze , Hong Kong
Hotel Mi
7.9 Very good
Based on 57 reviews

We chose Hotel Mi in part due to close proximity to MRT, but the location is so good that we often walked anyway (around Little India, back from Merlion Park).

The double room is inner-city small, with not much room around the bed. Bed sheets and towels are brand new and spotless, and the en suite is well designed and sparkling. Large window, with excellent blackout blind; good choice of lighting; good HD TV; good safe; simple tea/coffee; only a little space for clothes. Shampoo/gel provided, along with soap, toothbrushes, shower cap. Breakfast is OK in an emergency, but better/cheaper is available on the same road (and Google Maps says there are 18 Starbucks within 1 mile !) Staff are friendly and helpful. (Overall style is like a Holiday Inn Express, Travelodge, Hotel J, etc.) Would stay there again if the price was right. 4/5

Show more
Martin , United Kingdom
Marina Bay Sands
8.5 Excellent
Based on 20363 reviews

I stayed here for my last night in Singapore for a bit of a treat & I'm glad I did. I got there early (about 1pm) and was going to leave my bag with the Bell Boy while I went to Gardens by the Bay until the 3pm check in but my room was ready so I went straight up.

The room 1515 in tower 3 was spacious with everything you need with a view over the Entertainment Centre to the Merlion & The Fullerton Hotel. Bags dumped & up to the pool I go. What a spectacular view, breathtakingly stunning on a clear sunny day. I sat at the bar watching the staff do their magic with the cocktails taking it all in. Some of the best craftsmen/women I've ever seen. Headed over to Gardens by the Bay & made it back to the bar for sunset & night lights. The views got even better & the photos don't really do it justice. I didn't use the restaurants but there were plenty of them to choose from. I didn't use the minibar so it was locked & I could use the express check out as I had no charges to settle. It was a great stay, pricey but well worth it and I have no hesitation recommending a stay here. AAA+

Show more
Ian , Australia
Mandarin Orchard Singapore
8.3 Excellent
Based on 16803 reviews

We usually choose Orchard area for our conveniences and we found and get the best deal with Mandarin Orchard (if compare with others around this area) at Agoda.

This may our 4th or 5th time at this hotel and all as per expected. Only one wish; we would like to receive personal touch. This hotel and staffers, all are well organized, BUT a bit of robotic and really wish they can change real services with personal touch.

Show more
Nay , Myanmar
Carlton Hotel Singapore
8.2 Excellent
Based on 16015 reviews

Carlton was pretty awesome. The hotel was much bigger than I had expected. I really appreciate the beautiful lighting, the spaciousness, airiness, cleanliness, and great maintenance of the main hall and my hotel room.

Our room had plenty of natural light. It was such a great deal considering the amazing location of Carlton and the great facilities. Walking distance to several shopping areas and malls. Also the hip area Chimes is right across the road from Carlton. I would totally stay here again. The staff were nice, however you do have to line up and wait for check in and check out.

Show more
Chau , Vietnam
V Hotel Lavender
7.4 Very good
Based on 29069 reviews

This hotel is located centrally above the Lavender MRT station. Around the hotel there are plenty of local food choices plus a Fair Price supermarket nearby.

However the bathroom is super small and you might turn the hot shower into a cold or scalding one if you are not careful. Though the open air buffet breakfast is on the 4th floor with a nice breeze, the food choices are very limited and you might end up having bird droppings on your clothes or food..

Show more
Meen , Malaysia
Hotel Boss
7.8 Very good
Based on 4403 reviews

Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Breakfast was overpriced and had very little taste or variety.

Staff were not friendly in the slightest. Had been there for 2 days when we realised we had items taken from our room by what we assumed to be the cleaning staff who were the only ones to have access. Valued over 100 AUD. When we spoke to management about it they told us that they would have to investigate and would get back to us within a week (no good for us leaving the country) and when we told him this he simply said call the police to which we declined. Received and email days later saying that because they couldn't prove it that there was nothing they could do and no compensation would be given. Why would anyone stay at a hotel where you can't even trust the cleaners to not steal your belongings? And management can't resolve an incident on the spot? Instead they waited for us to leave the country then turned their back on us! Terrible customer service and management.

Show more
Melanie , Australia
York Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 12356 reviews

As a family we started staying at the York since 2005. The hotel location is great for shopping. We always stayed in the new wing which was reasonably nice and clean.

However, this time we stayed on the other side and the conditions of the hotel are terrible for the price. The rooms smelt awful, cups and glasses had lipstick left on them. The shower was black with dirt and grime. The carpet was old and stained. Our adult children's shower had no hot water and only dribbled out. There was no shampoo or conditioner and the other assortments were cheap and smelt awful. This was the most disappointing stay and should be classed as 2-3 Star. We will never go back to stay.

Show more
Natalie , Qatar
Grand Park Orchard
8.2 Excellent
Based on 8008 reviews

Inefficient staff upon check in. We asked if it is possible to check into room earlier (1,5hrs). Although it is hotel policy whether this is possible or not, staff could reinstate hotel policy/condition in professional&friendly manner.

After all, we are paying GUEST staying at your hotel. Staff rudely said it is not possible, must come back in 1hour. Then she forgot to take deposit and called us to our room demanding deposit payment immediately to follow hotel rules. We explained that we do not mind. Room was prepaid in agoda so Paying deposit of $150 is not a big drama; if it was informed when Checking in earlier, it would have saved us 2 trips going to receptionist and completing the same steps. Receptionist was very rude& not professional. Considering that receptionist staff are the first faces Guest will encounter, i think Management should retrain & teach them how to be the best representative of the Hotel. Very disappointing.

Show more
Andika , Indonesia
PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road Singapore
7.7 Very good
Based on 3464 reviews

Love the location in Little India. Lots of great restaurants and many vegetarian restaurants too. There's a good shopping centre just across the road and directly behind the hotel is "Mustafas Department Store and Supermarket".

Shopping at Mustafas is a real experience!! There's a MRT straight across the road which makes getting to and from other places real easy. Great breakfasts too but if you want to eat local then we recommend Maraj across the road. We love a breakfast of banana prata with Indian curry as an accompaniment along with hot sweet tea. We always stay at the Park Royal because we enjoy it so much.

Show more
Cynthia , Australia
Concorde Hotel Singapore
7.9 Very good
Based on 4497 reviews

We've stayed at Concorde for our past visits to singapore due to its very accessible location. This time we booked the premier club room.

Lots of privileges included with this package which we surely enjoyed and appreciated. The hosts were very friendly and helpful especially Ruth who was at the premier lounge. However, one problem we had were the renovations. On our first day, we were not given a room til around 4 pm, because when we arrived at 3, workers were still inside our room, installing lighting fixtures. Also, there were paint odors in the hallways and in our room. We were also worried about safety of the rooms, because there were a lot of workers walking around the halls. Overall, it was a good stay. Maybe when the renovations are finished, it'll be a really great hotel to stay in.

Show more
Ma. , Philippines
Royal Plaza on Scotts Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 8595 reviews

I took a chance on this hotel as all the other chain hotels like the Marriott or Hyatt on Orchard Road were either full or very expensive.

I'm very glad I did and I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is perfectly located on Orchard Road along side all the malls and there's easy access to the Orchard MRT. There's even a Starbucks right up front. The hotel room was very spacious and clean. The staff friendly. The only thing l missed vs the other hotels is a lobby area that is conducive to meeting or gathering. I needed to meet with someone for about an hour and had to meet at Starbucks. Other than that, this is quite on par with other 4+star hotels at better value.

Show more
Elisa , United States
Marina Mandarin Singapore Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7025 reviews

Slow check in (An hour) so requested for a late check because I know it would take sometime if the check out was at 12noon.

Rude hotel staff and also, they judge you from the way you dressed. Looking at you as though you were unable to afford the stay or the food at Aquamarine. The management ought to train their staff extensively before putting them on the floor. Was given the wrong information e.g. Snobbish recep girl said deposit cannot be paid via debit when in fact you CAN. And the concierge told us that the parking coupon was free as and when we like upon requested. When the fact is the complimentary parking coupon is for a time use PER DAY or you could pay $10 per day for valet (unlimited). The view for the bay is so beautiful tho the size of the room is so small and dated. In dire need of an overhaul. The hotel has lost me. Overpriced stay. Not worth it. Could have gone for Pan Pac or Fairmont.

Show more
Nurashikin , Singapore
Hotel Jen Tanglin Singapore by Shangri-la
7.8 Very good
Based on 2743 reviews

Location is near enough but still far to local shops although it is attached to a mall the mall is quite small and has gourmet supermarkets which was quite expensive.

The food hall was under renovations so food was limited. Other than that the pool and gym was great and I loved the modern design of the room. Internet worked perfectly and the breakfast spread looked great.

Show more
Sophia , Malaysia
Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 10443 reviews

For what was paid for the night, we had a comfortable bed, good water pressure in the bathroom and great location (walking distance to Fort Canning Park, National Gallery, the River, Timbre, live music joint excellent for thin crust pizza).

It was our last night in Singapore, and we had an early flight, so it would not have been worth paying too much money for just a few hours. The staff was attentive, and able to accommodate my requests: king-size bed, higher floors, with a nice view. It's a nice place, but the room(s) may only be partially updated, you can tell it's an older property which was a prime in it's hay-day, maybe in the 1990's or so. Not bad value for the money, to be in Singapore, considering the price tag of other properties around.

Show more
Hang , United States
Hotel Jen Orchardgateway Singapore
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2966 reviews

I stayed here for 3d/4n and loved every second of it. We chose this hotel because of its accessibility and complete amenities.

It has all the necessities to make your travel a smooth and pleasant one. Comfortable bed, bathroom, plenty of storage space and strategically placed outlets and sockets, all the essentials we need these days for compact travelling. The room size is also very comfortable for two people. We brought 2 very large luggage and 2 handcarry luggage and still have enough space to walk around and store things in the wardrobe. But what I love the most is the free high speed wireless internet all day long. It made my travel planning much more easier. They also supply free drinking water and ice at the hallway. Like I said, basic neccessities are very well taken care of. Definitely will stay again with you, Jen ❤️

Show more
Novita , Indonesia
V Hotel Bencoolen
7.1 Very good
Based on 5689 reviews

The location of the hotel was great, just a few minutes walk away from Bras Rasah MRT Station, and there is also a Food Republic and 7-11 just a few minutes walk away.

However, the air circulation in the room that we were staying was kinda bad. Whenever we adjusted the air-conditioner to >22^C (because the room get cold very quickly, as it is not that big), the room had an awful smell. Other than this, everything was good. The hotel staffs are very friendly, and ready to share any information to us.

Show more
Lily , Malaysia
One Farrer Hotel and Spa
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2070 reviews

Chose this hotel because of a good offer we found on Agoda. Wasn't expecting much because the reviews were quite mixed.

We checked in late (around 10.30 pm - 11 pm) and was assisted by Sean at the front desk. We got upgraded from the Urban room we booked originally to the Loft Apartment. The upgraded room was quite something. Floor to ceiling window, a small pantry, work space & living room upstairs...pretty lavish. Room was well appointed. And the floor(s) and room is decorated with really good modern arts which I really enjoyed. Great big bed with ample amount of pillow...needless to say, sleep quality was really good. The bathroom was spacious with very good quality toiletries. Service (esp. housekeeping) was wonderful. I would probably stay again just for the swimming pool..my God. I took early evening swims and it was brilliant. Great setting, with Singapore skyline as the view. They have small gardens you can walk in and a bar by the pool. The hotel is a very short 3-minute-ish walk from the Farrer Park MRT station. And also within short walking distances to Mustafa Center & City Square Mall. Also quite close (short taxi rides) to some very good eateries near the stadium in Jalan Besar, Tyrwhitt Rd & Beach Rd. The Farrer Park Hospital adjoins the hotel. In short, recommended.

Show more
Belinda , Indonesia
Capella Singapore Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 682 reviews

I love the location, the design of the room, serenity of the place and attentive service! It would have been better if the balcony and seats in the balcony were really clean (no leaves on seat cushions, corners were wiped clean), fixed seating and cushions at window side have evident stains (wish it wasn't what we were thinking of) and if they can install a handspray in the toilet or watercloset area.

Some people prefer to use water after doing their business rather than just relying on tissue paper. Other than that, staff were very friendly and attentive. Like when we asked for directions they did not only provide the directions but ushered us to the location. They have an in depth knowledge of their products and services. However for the spa, I hoped my masseuse was able to explain thoroughly what was happening.

Show more
Nancy , Philippines
Hotel Grand Central
7.5 Very good
Based on 918 reviews

Now we all know, Singapore is NOT cheap. But here you don't get what you pay for. No pool tools, no bottled water, just a water machine in room.

The room is basically ALL bed, very tiny. Te bathroom had an unbearable stench from the drain, I mentioned, they addressed, and still the smell remained.. I asked front desk walking directions to notable location, they said 5-10 minutes by foot. After 30 mins, I gave up & hailed a taxi. Front desk was woefully understaffed, took 15 minutes to get attended to. I could go on, but better you look elsewhere!!!!

Show more
michael , United States
Studio M Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 11236 reviews

This is the lowest score I'm giving to a hotel. The check in process is by far the worst I've experienced.

We arrived in the hotel at 2pm and we're asked to queue. It took us 45mins to get to the check-in counter from the queue. The staff told us that we had to wait for another 20mina as our room wasn't cleaned up yet. He told us we would get a txt once it's ready but we never received one, so we just went back to the counter. At last we're able to lay down our bed after 1.5hrs of waiting. The room had only 1 set of robes and towels and it took us 2 calls to get the other set delivered to our room. Upon checkout (they extended our checkout to 3pm btw to compensate for the delayed checkin), we saw a long queue for check-in. I think the guests for that day suffered the same fate as ours.

Show more
Bien , Philippines
Ramada Singapore at Zhongshan Park
8 Very good
Based on 1864 reviews

Great value for a 4-star hotel -- considering it's in expensive Singapore. All of the amenities you'd expect from Ramada.

And they truly cater to guests -- excellent shuttle to nearby MRT, they held our luggage all day after checkout, and offered showers when we returned in the evening (after checking out in the morning). Very pleasant and helpful staff, top-notch swimming pool and gym. My only "complaint" is the limited number and types of TV channels -- but that doesn't matter much if you intend to spend your time exploring the city.

Show more
Mark , United States
Orchard Hotel Singapore
7.8 Very good
Based on 4929 reviews

I selected the Orchard Hotel based on the 5 star reviews and the value for money which was half the price of other five star hotels in the area.

The value for money was there but don't expect much from the breakfast buffet spread which was very average nor the cleanliness of the pool area which suffers from a lot of late night party traffic. Beer cans and towels were strewn all over the as I did my 6 am swim. The hotel rooms were clean but a bit dated. The location was the upside being in the heart of the city but the downside was being opposite the infamous Orchard Tower which houses less family friendly activity by night. If you are just there for business at a good value, I would recommend the Orchard Hotel but I go elsewhere with the family or fiancee.

Show more
Kenneth , United States
Days Hotel Singapore At Zhongshan Park
7.9 Very good
Based on 3723 reviews

Clean and quiet. A bit far from nearest MRT station (Novena) but the hotel makes up for it with a free shuttle bus (takes 10 ~ 15 minutes).

There is also a free shuttle bus to Orchard Road. Check time tables. Walking distance to numerous eateries on Balestier Road (reputable among locals). Did not use the free (data, local and international calls) mobile phone (could take out of hotel room) but appreciated the convenience offered. Would have wanted the free wifi (cut off at 10am) till the end of the check out day. Would also have liked shower facility (not offered) after check out.

Show more
Chen-Fang , Australia
Furama City Centre Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 3634 reviews

I know this hotel is not people first choice when choosing hotels in Singapore. I am a Singaporean and if any of my oversea guests visiting Singapore, I always book Furama for them.

It may look old in external but the room is clean and well maintained. The price is reasonable as Singapore hotel is expensive in general. The room size is acceptable and the food is alright as well. It is near MRT station, with North East Line and Downtown Line, you can easily reaching Singapore famous place of interest such as Sentosa, Marina Bay Sand, Garden by the bay, Singapore Flyer etc.Regardless of price, I will choose Furama over any hotel in Orchard Road or City Hall.

Show more
Kin , Singapore
Furama RiverFront Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 3995 reviews

Booked an expensive separate bedroom room, room was huge however everything in it needed to be replaced due to age, tv in the bedroom only showed lines tv in the living room was fine, bed hard as rock, absolutely nothing on the wall to break up the grey monotonous look no pictures no paint difference, tiny windows in the living room also.

Small shower dark but huge bathroom with a lip to trip over on the way in, nice bathtub. Seat in the bedroom also in the wrong century. Club lounge was fine with enough to choose from morning and evening. All the staff we met were great and are the only reason my review is not more negative. I suggest if the hotel owners want to keep competing they really do need to up there game & spend money on re modeling the rooms and upgrading the floors etc the grandeur of the lobby floor does not cover for the dated look of the rest of the place. To sum up, the $2 charge per sheet of A4 for printing while paying almost $300 for a room is embarassing

Show more
SHANE , Canada
Oasia Hotel Novena Singapore by Far East Hospitality
8.3 Excellent
Based on 5939 reviews

We love, love the location. The access to MRT is excellent - it is under the hotel but not so directly under it that you can hear/see/be bothered by the crowd.

It has a rather long underground access from station to hotel but very convenient. We stayed on the Club Room floor, which has narrow alleyway, but quie. Very good bedding (although a few items looked worn - one pillow case had a tear). Good sleep quality. The room lighting is reaaallyy nice. This was really a highlight for me. The Club Room facilities were very good. The room are very well appointed - although quite small. They had amenities hidden away, Scandinavian style. Spacious bathroom with Harn Thann bath amenties (love!), good breakfast (without the overwhelming amount of selection), good service from all levels/department. We booked on a promo rate, hence, very good value for money. The hotel can be a little pricey, but would still recommend as the overall experience was very satisfactory!

Show more
Belinda , Indonesia
Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality
7.4 Very good
Based on 6261 reviews

I checked into Village Hotel Bugis for a staycation (I had a full day function to attend there one of the days, and it was a long weekend).

The room was nice enough; it's been refurbished. The bed was huge and comfortable. The common areas are run-down, though, and could benefit from a major sprucing up. My major peeve was how hard it was to get into the driveway leading to the car park. One way roads, no entry roads, etc. all around meant my GPS led me round and round, ad nauseam, without us being able to get in, and wasting precious minutes. The pool is too small, and the room service roast chicken was really bad. I don't think I will stay here again, even though it's so near Haji Lane (with so many cool shops).

Park Hotel Farrer Park
8.5 Excellent
Based on 294 reviews

I have stayed with Park hotel a couple of times. Usually, i would request for a 2nd bottle of mineral water as 1 bottle for a day is not sufficient.

However, I was told that a second bottle of mineral water for the same guest is chargeable. First time I am hearing this from Park Hotel, quite surprising. Fine, i have to go out to the super market to get myself a decent mineral water at a decent price. I was informed that requesting for additional items like toothbrush is also subjected to approval from the manager. So i guess there is no need for me to request additional sugar for my coffee as 1 room has only 2 small packets of sugar (i.e. 1 packet per guest). Quite a bad impression I have in terms of logistic control. I would prefer my stay back at Park Hotel Clarke Quay or Alexandra.

We are a return hotel guest. Every year, my family will have staycation one or twice in this hotel. The hotel location is far away from city so is a great get away from the crowdy population in Singapore.

It is located near the beach and park and my family love nature and outdoor. One this day, I approched the front deck to check in, the front deck staff, Ms Sheda saw me and recognized me immediately. She gave me a warm welcome and handled my check in at a breezes. She has brighten my day. And when my family was having breakfast the next morning, a waitress who served us also recognized us. The feeling is like we are living in our second home. The overall experience staying in this hotel has not failed us. All the staff are friendly and helpful. We would like to extend our thanks to the front desk, the restaurant staff and the housekeeping who made our stay a great and wonderful

This was the second time we stayed at Rasa Sentosa Hotel and we were very glad we did. It was a relaxing and pleasurable stay.

The staff are so friendly and helpful and we were very impressed that they remember your name. The only drawback would be the pool closes too early. Overall we would go back again if we had the chance.

So I paid almost $500 for one night. I got two rooms. One room had faulty air conditioning which was perpetually at 16degrees, the same room had a faulty TV audio which sounded really flat and just was painful to the ears.

The other room had thick dust and hair under the bed, we knew because something dropped and we tried to retrieve it. Under the sofa was a USED paper plate which did not belong to us. After the first night, we had towels and robes cleared from our room but was never replaced. Called front desk to inquire about adding an extra bed, but was met with a condescending tone insinuating I was too cheap to pay the extra charge and/or did not understand what the $70 set-up of sofa bed included. Overall, really bad and poor maintained hotel with long check-in waiting time for the price of $500. I'd pay $200 at max.

We arrived at the hotel lobby with no staff to help with unloading. me and my husband unloaded all the stuff ourselves.

there were only two staff around at check in. The staff who attended to me, I only remembered him telling me, only tomorrow we will know if we can check out later than 12 noon. I think most of us are aware about the late check out procedures but I only needed him to put the request up so that the next staff that serves me would know I had requested for late check out in advance. We were then sent to our room, but Realized they had given us the "wrong" room. Because of the confusing info on agoda(pictures with the living area,which the couple suite does not have)I thought I had paid for the family suite, but was given the Couple suite . Luckily, the family suite was available and they shifted us up. I requested extra pillows and towels, it took forever to send. and the reception was forever not picking up. Quite a disappointment with the standard and service of Amara.

We stayed at HRH Penang, Malaysia before this, so we keep comparing both. We think this one is more expensive and expected come with much fun experience.

Unfortunately is not as what we expect. the facilities are quite far behind than Penang. No welcome drink, the reception area is quite empty, bored and not energetic enough. No snack at room's bar, only tea coffee. The beach is nice, but not private as at Penang( more suitable for family, not for couple stay). limited TV channels, some movie need to pay extra charged (be careful). The good facility is they provide a smartphone to be used for free internet and for the local and international call (limited country). It also located at good location, near to USS. Other than that, as couple traveler, we preferred Penang than Sentosa. the Sentosa is more suitable for family. Thanks a lot to MS. I have been staying at this resort for over 10 years now. It's half the price of the other resorts on Sentosa.

It's location is great halfway between the mono rail and cable car both of which take you into the shopping centre (vivo city) on the harbour front. From there you can make your way into the city. It has a big pool also. Rooms adequate. There is no pool bar as such but every now and then a staff member may be around where the towels are and will take your drink order. The breakfast is not as big as you would normally expect and whilst the staff are friendly they don't strike you as attentive as other resorts. This is a resort that gets you on Sentosa without blowing your budget so with a big pool and central location it really can't be beaten for value. I'll be back again.

I am quite pleased with the friendly and helpful check-in staff but at the same time quite appalled with the service staff manning the line for room support as well as the staff at the concierge at 6.

15am. We booked the hotel so we can go to the Justice League Run, I asked the lady manning the counter at the concierge how best I can go to the starting point. Show more Sze , Hong Kong Hotel Mi 7.9 Very good Based on 57 reviews We chose Hotel Mi in part due to close proximity to MRT, but the location is so good that we often walked anyway (around Little India, back from Merlion Park). The double room is inner-city small, with not much room around the bed. Bed sheets and towels are brand new and spotless, and the en suite is well designed and sparkling. Large window, with excellent blackout blind; good choice of lighting; good HD TV; good safe; simple tea/coffee; only a little space for clothes. Shampoo/gel provided, along with soap, toothbrushes, shower cap. Breakfast is OK in an emergency, but better/cheaper is available on the same road (and Google Maps says there are 18 Starbucks within 1 mile !) Staff are friendly and helpful. (Overall style is like a Holiday Inn Express, Travelodge, Hotel J, etc.) Would stay there again if the price was right. 4/5 Show more Martin , United Kingdom Marina Bay Sands 8.5 Excellent Based on 20363 reviews I stayed here for my last night in Singapore for a bit of a treat & I'm glad I did. I got there early (about 1pm) and was going to leave my bag with the Bell Boy while I went to Gardens by the Bay until the 3pm check in but my room was ready so I went straight up. The room 1515 in tower 3 was spacious with everything you need with a view over the Entertainment Centre to the Merlion & The Fullerton Hotel. Bags dumped & up to the pool I go. What a spectacular view, breathtakingly stunning on a clear sunny day. I sat at the bar watching the staff do their magic with the cocktails taking it all in. Some of the best craftsmen/women I've ever seen. Headed over to Gardens by the Bay & made it back to the bar for sunset & night lights. The views got even better & the photos don't really do it justice. I didn't use the restaurants but there were plenty of them to choose from. I didn't use the minibar so it was locked & I could use the express check out as I had no charges to settle. It was a great stay, pricey but well worth it and I have no hesitation recommending a stay here.
